review: The equipment and user interface are all decent but could use a little improvement.  Overall this is a great tool for accessing general and Prim Amazon content.  The few minor gripes below are far outweighed by all the cool things you can do with this Fire TV Stick.Equipment: It was disappointing that the Fire TV Stick cannot be powered by an available USB port on my television rather it has to be plugged in.  After attempting to power it via USB the unit kept restarting until it was plugged into a 120v outlet, and with enough other "stuff" already plugged in it was a bit of drag.  The remote is a bit flimsy and feels like it is not going to last as long as the Stick itself, but there is an option to download the app for your smartphone and use it as the remote.  Other than that, there is a very well thought out HDMI dongle/extension included in case your television has a limited nook or crannie where the HDMI ports are.  In general the equipment is decent, just a little odd.Interface:  The interface is a bit goofy from a navigation aspect and there is no way to turn this thing off without unplugging.  See the equipment comment about power above for discussion of the hard power requirement.  The navigation is a bit linear without easy ways to navigate through watch lists or music playlists without scrolling thru the entire thing.  If you have long watch or play lists hopefully you also have some patience.  There is also a tendency for the scrolling feature from the remote to skip through 4 menu items up or down with a single click, which can give you a Wheel of Fortune type feeling when trying land on a specific menu item.  Generally the goofy interface and other navigation issues are minor compared to the benefits.  At least there is direct interface to this device unlike the Google competitor (which I love and use regularly as well).
